Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Cliotide T1 (cT1; natural AMPs; cyclotides; XXC; 3S=S, UCBB1ab; Fabaceae, plants; Other possible AMPs? Cliotide T5,  Cliotide T6,  Cliotide T8,  Cliotide T9,  Cliotide T11)

Literature Information.Literature: Activity: Active against E. coli (MIC 1.1 uM), K. pneumonia (MIC 2.7 uM), and P. aeruginosa (MIC 4.7 uM). Cliotides T5 to T12 have not been collected into the APD owing to the lack of activity data.Peptide stability: Heat-stable. Will cyclotides share similar physiological functions of Albumin-1?Formatted 8/2024
Literature Information.Author: Nguyen GK, Zhang S, Nguyen NT, Nguyen PQ, Chiu MS, Hardjojo A, Tam JP.2011
Literature Information.Title: Discovery and characterization of novel cyclotides originated from chimeric precursors consisting of albumin-1 chain a and cyclotide domains in the fabaceae family
